name: Sodium fluoride
desc: Sodium fluoride (NaF) is a chemical compound and medication. As a medication it is primarily used to prevent tooth decay in children older than 6 months in areas where the drinking water is low in fluoride. Sodium fluoride is used as a liquid, pill, or paste by mouth with this use being known as fluoride therapy.
Solubility:
slightly soluble in HF, ammonia
negligible in alcohol, acetone, SO2, dimethylformamide
Other anions:
Sodium chloride
Sodium bromide
Sodium iodide
Sodium astatide
Other cations:
Lithium fluoride
Potassium fluoride
Rubidium fluoride
Caesium fluoride
Francium fluoride
